website_summaries.verdict: Innovative design – the silicone lid provides protection from freezer odors and holds water and other liquids in place during transfers. Affordable retail price.
pros: Users can refill partially empty trays, not "all or nothing."
Tray size is compact, allowing for more stacking
Individual cubes are shaped for easy removal
cons: Plastic tray can transfer unpleasant taste
Silicone lid does not form leak-resistant seal, and trays are not angle-proof
Lid relies on surface tension to work properly

customer_reviews.title: Product review after 1 year of use - DO NOT BUY, ICE SMELL!
customer_reviews.text: So I was totally pleased with this product....until it stated to make my ice smell really awful. It has been one year since using this ice tray (and I bought 3). Both the plastic tray and the silicon cover absorbed freezer smell and transfered it to the ice cubes. Please do not buy unless you intend to trash them ever so often. I have a pretty clean freezer, so it took a while for the smell to complete spoil the trays. Other reviewers were right about them getting smelly. :((
customer_reviews.author: Stitches

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a few months
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a few months. But as many others have reported, after that, the plastic completely absorbs all of the freezer burn flavors and no amount of washing or soaking in white vinegar can take that nauseating smell out of the plastic, nor the taste out of your ice. Just know you will have to buy new ones every few months. :(
customer_reviews.author: JSS

customer_reviews.title: Has a plastic smell that won't go away
customer_reviews.text: Has a funky smell and it doesn't go away after you wash it. Your ice will not taste very good. I'm an OXO fan but this one is a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: nauseating horrible smell that permeates the dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: where do I begin with how horrible the smell is of this product? It seemed fine for a while, but yesterday I noticed my water and ice tasted and smelled awful. My freezer is clean and our fridge is only 6 months old so that is not the problem. I put the tray in the dishwasher AND ALL OF MY DISHES AND DISHWASHER SMELL LIKE SOMETHING I HAVE NEVER EXPERIENCED. I ran the dishwasher twice since without the tray in and I cannot get rid of the smell. What in the world is in this product???? I am seriously concerned. Do not buy this. Search for something else and never look back.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: The blue rubber tray cover develops permanent freezer odors that flavor the ice
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these for the first six or eight months we owned them. But a couple years later and all the ice that comes out of them have a disgusting odor and flavor that comes from the rubber plastic cover of the trays. I have tried washing this cover, but the odors have permeated them deeply. This is a surprising design flaw from a company whose products I generally like and given the reviews these have received.
customer_reviews.author: Logan S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great (see notes)
customer_reviews.text: this product works excellent as long as you follow these steps : 1) hot liquid freezes faster than cold, makes ice clear, and COMES OUT WHOLE 2) fill the tray so that each slot is completely full to the point of being slightly too full. as they freeze, each cube will expand giving you a little ridge to lift them out of the tray you will have clear whole tubes
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Other reviewers correct: starts stinking after 3 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 3 months. Now it absorbs - and traps - freezer burn smells much more than a "normal" open ice cube tray without a lid. It's amazing but true - my favorite tray literally turned into a pumpkin at 3 months and is now unusable. It doesn't look or feel any different, but it, and the ice it makes, stinks like it's been in the freezer for a decade. Crazy.
customer_reviews.author: pinkerton

customer_reviews.title: Bake it to get rid of smells
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal ice cube tray. I've hated refilling ice cubes since I was a kid and used to put them back empty all the time much to The dismay of my parents. Now it's fun! I try really hard to get no air pockets in any of the cubes. The silicone top does pick up freezer smell after a while, but fortunately there is a solution! Remove the silicone overlay and bake it in the oven. do not bake the plastic tray. 300° for 10 or 15 minutes is usually fine. This also works for instant pot gaskets.
customer_reviews.author: Mister B

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Ice stick tray
customer_reviews.text: I like lemon in my water and don't always have fresh lemons in the house so I squeeze fresh lemons and freeze the juice. This is perfect for that. Just the right size for popping into a bottle of water. Can't speak to the no leak part as I'm not brave enough to tip this on it's side until after frozen. The frozen lemon juice is a little sticky and so a little tricky to get out of the tray but I've figured out a way. Should have discovered this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: KarenKB

customer_reviews.title: Too wide for Bkr bottles
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I wanted ice for my Bkr bottles but didn’t want to pay almost $20 for the Bkr brand trays. I was also drawn to this because it is covered by the silicone sheet to keep out contaminants. This did not work out. Too wide for the glass Bkr openings. I will use this for something else because it was definitely not inexpensive for one single tray either. If you are looking for an alternative to Bkr brand trays, this is not it :(
customer_reviews.author: Raspberry

customer_reviews.title: 1 star for false advertising - It does spill, and has zero seal.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this has 1500 reviews and most of them being positive. Put water in this thing, turned it sideways over the sink as they advertise in the video, just to test it out. What happened? Shocking...it spilled the water everywhere. They're frauds. While the silicone cover is neat for stacking ice trays, and keeping debris out of the ice, it is 100% false advertising that this thing can be turned sideways for storage in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ice Trays
customer_reviews.text: Since my ice machine stopped working, I needed some ice trays. These are fantastic! Easy to fill, then you run your hand over the silicon top, drain the excess water and put it in the freezer at any angle. It really doesn’t leak! To remove the cubes just twist. They sometimes stick to the silicon but are easy to wipe off. If it really bothers you, you can not fill the cubes to the top. Great product. I now have 3 of them. They stack easily and keep any smells out.
customer_reviews.author: KindnessMatters

customer_reviews.title: Won't sit at "any" angle...
customer_reviews.text: Though the product description says the tray can be placed at any angle in the freezer, the actual packaging says there's a limit. Unfortunately, we've thrown out the packaging, but the manufacturer-recommended angle was somewhere in the neighborhood of 45-degrees. What's the use, at that point? I should have known that an ice cube tray you can freeze straight up and down was too good, in a space-saving sense, to be true...
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Truly Works
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool I removed my icemaker years ago--I got tired of the endless supply of ice cubes I never use. That and the fact that cubes from the icemaker dissolved so fast I bought trays--harder ice cubes and slow to dissolve Then I saw some crazy Russian guy re viewing this on FaceBook Holy Cow This tray is PERFECT--and it DOES NOT LEAK with the silicone flap Buying another one !!
customer_reviews.author: Bon

customer_reviews.title: Fine but not as good as it seems
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this ice cube tray because is theory it’s perfect- doesn’t have to be frozen completely flat, makes ice cubes the right size for my metal bottles, etc. Sadly it doesn’t really work like that. My ice cubes break every single time I pop them out, which makes them melt way too fast in my bottle. The pour off function with the lid so you can freeze at an angle means I end up with empty wells in the back nearly every time. It’s just a flawed design. It’s really a shame.
customer_reviews.author: abby

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this product because it is amazing in all its features but, it started to smell!
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, this product has so much attention to detail from the miraculous non spill that actually works even when setting the trays at angles and the rounded ice mold makes removing ice super easy but after a while the lid started developing a horrible smell that smells like a freezer full of acetone and nail polish. I've washed a few times and couldn't get rid of the smell and so I'm wary of using it for now. I will try leaving in warm soapy water and see if I can get rid of it and hopefully use it because I do love it, but if not it's going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Geralt Of Rivia

customer_reviews.title: Using to store extra breastmilk and it works great. Twist the tray to loosen the sticks and ...
customer_reviews.text: Using to store extra breastmilk and it works great. Twist the tray to loosen the sticks and then push on one end to lever the sticks out. Each stick is about 0.5 ounces. Cheaper than the milkies ice tray.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Do you like the taste of chemicals?
customer_reviews.text: This ice tray may be convenient for avoiding spilling water but definitely not worth having everything you use with ice taste like chemicals. I washed this tray so many time thinking it would eventually go away but it never did. I had to toss out every drink I put ice cubes in, it was disgusting. I definitely do not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: James Lenhart

customer_reviews.title: SMELLY!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a while I really liked them at first but the smell of the silicone is overwhelming...I have tried cleaning them several ways but the smell remains...
customer_reviews.author: redwards4

customer_reviews.title: Better Ice tray
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get my ice out of my ice trays that came with my refrigerator. I tried some others, they were not as easy as it should be. I saw a show where a Science teacher was testing out Ice trays and making better ice cubes for everything. He recommended this as one of his favorites. I noticed the ease of how he was able to get the ice out of the tray, and it was not going to make a mess with the water when getting it to the freezer with the cover it has to protect from spills. Very happy, I use it daily. Happy Customer will recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cinderellasnickers

customer_reviews.title: Best Ice Cube Tray
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing it at a friend's home. It makes slightly rounded ice cubes that easily slide out of the plastic. The silicone "lid" is the best feature. It keeps the water from spilling out if it isn't level in the freezer and I also feel like it adds that needed barrier to prevent any unwanted flavors getting trapped in the cubes. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PoconoMom3

customer_reviews.title: Pricier than most but not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item with the intention of using the ice in my water bottle. To begin, these trays are more expensive than most others so I was expecting a product that would clearly show quality and concept. It shows neither. The ice slots are small and each time you try to get a cube out it breaks into tiny pieces. I washed the trays prior to using them. I believe that voids a potential refund because I would like to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Berg

customer_reviews.title: No smell after nearly a year
customer_reviews.text: I was initially hesitant to purchase after reading so many reviews saying it attains a gross smell. I use it only when making ice and when I'm not it doesnt stay in my freezer. The cubes are perfect. Hoping it does not break for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Elva

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding! But buy more than one!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! But, buy at least two. There are 12 perfectly boat shaped cubes. We bought the Swell thermos in both the bike and day-large sizes. We found using the cold Brita pitcher water from the frig and 4 to 6 cubes to last all day and what treat too as the super cold water is so refreshing in the summer. The stainless steel mouth piece of the Swell bottles tempers the brain 'lip-touch' so you dont think its too cold. We found for two people, we needed two trays. One is cooling ice while we consume from the other solid tray. Example: So you end up using one of the trays' on alternate days.
customer_reviews.author: JB Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for Vertical Storage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use in my icebox on the boat. I had intended it to fit vertically and hold the water.. well tried that and water leaked out all over the bottom of the freezer portion on my icebox. I was so disappointed. I wrapped it in small freezer sized ziplock bags and it works better but only half of the water stays in the tray. Its too big to fit horizontally down into my freezer. I researched the product and from the reviews, I was certain that it was going to be perfect. Well, not so. Still using it but it's not working all that well for what I had intended for it. For others, ok..
customer_reviews.author: Tayloranne 13

customer_reviews.title: Haven't been able warm up to this ice tray.
customer_reviews.text: I usually like ZOO products so I bought this without checking the reviews. Maybe I'm not swiping the lid properly, but I have spills all the way to the freezer. Now I see all the reviews about odors. I think I'll return this before I encounter that problem. I'll look for something smaller. This tray is humongous.
customer_reviews.author: Roxie509

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to Use, Wastes Water
customer_reviews.text: I too bought this ice tray based on the review in an article online. It certainly has good features: keeps the ice smelling fresh, less sublimation, and can be stored on its side. That said, it's also a pain to use. It's awkward to hold the silicon cover back as you release the cubes and dump them into an ice tray. The cubes are on the small side, so they melt faster than larger ones. You also end up wasting water due to the design. The water doesn't flow through the molds, but tends to run into the gutter on the outside of the tray. It's also quite costly for an ice tray.
customer_reviews.author: CDubya

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love that these have the silicone covers so they can be stacked or stuff put on top if needed but the ice cubes are protected. They have an extra bit of plastic to use as a handle for in and out of the freezer. The cubes come out fairly easily although these have a weird trough around the edge that can collect water/ice which I suppose could also be used for ice cubes. The cube voids are a little shallow so don't expect big cubes. I got 2 so I could make plenty and stack them. They are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Toadcrystal

customer_reviews.title: Ok I guess
customer_reviews.text: The "cubes" come out of the tray easily and are a good size for beverages. The silicone topper is nice for stacking and avoiding spills but the molds for the cubes don't flow into each other when you fill them. This is probably fine for most people but filling from a water filter is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: The Best Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at how wonderful this ice tray is!! The ice cubes are so easy to get out, due to the rounded bottom. I have had many different ice trays in my 73 years, and have finally found the PERFECT ice tray. Since it is rather large, and my freezer isn't all that big, I built a little cardboard "garage" to slip the ice tray into, so I could put other items on top of it. My only suggestion to OXO would be to offer an optional "garage" into which the ice tray could be housed. Anyway, this is a great product, and I'm glad to have finally found the PERFECT ice tray!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nesbit

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. The whole idea of this is to be able to put this in at an angle and not have it leak. I have mine in at about a 15 degree angle and it doesn't leak into the freezer but it does leak into the sides of the tray. It's also just a pain having a lid on an ice cube tray. I was into making smoothies over the summer so I was looking forward to having a new ice cube tray that I could just throw into the freezer without worrying about it leaking everywhere but this was just underwhelming for the price you pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for bottles that have a small opening. I will probably get more than one because sometimes the ice cubes break up depending on how well you fill the tray. But I do love it.
customer_reviews.author: mn

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these trays. I had a few of the regular cube model, so I decided to try the bottle size cube tray. They are a bit expensive as far as ice cube trays go but they are amazing. They don't feel fragile, regular plastic trays I always feel like are about to shatter when I twist them to free the cubes. The silicone sheet on top is great for me because I have to keep my ice cube trays in a box freezer and they can't always sit up perfectly level.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kline

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I am elderly, shaky, and drink a lot of ice water. When properly filled, this does not spill when walking to and from the refrig, easy to fill. easy to remove ice; bullets fit in my narrow necked water bottle perfectly. I put all the ice bullets into the bottle at one time, fill with water and have cold water for almost 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Essiemae

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These are much larger than I anticipated. I attached a picture of one next to a standard ice cube tray. It barely fits in my tiny freezer. Other than that, I love it! Exactly as advertised, super easy to use, and high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS ICE TRAY
customer_reviews.text: This one is by far one of the best I've tried. Although not perfect there are occasional spills from adding too much water once you use it enough you'll start to perfect how much water is needed to fill the trays and avoid spillage. The ice is easily removed and refilled. Just a great product when you keep a packed freezer and require something which will keep the water in and other things out like remnants from other frozen products being stored with your ice tray.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jones

customer_reviews.title: Eliminates sloshing on way to the fridge
customer_reviews.text: These are a good quality product, and make nice sized ice cubes. They are very slim and can stack nicely on top of each other. I like the cover which seals out odors and gives it a pretty good seal against spilling. It is not a perfectly tight seal, you still need to be careful and not tip the trays while carrying them, but far better than juggling the open trays. I am happy with my purchase. Only bought two trays, wish I had gotten two more as they fit in the freezer so nicely and let you utilize space.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Boomer Dara

customer_reviews.title: Even my elderly, somewhat clumsy father could use these!
customer_reviews.text: I originally got these for my father when he moved into assisted living (the fridge there didn't have an ice maker). He did a lot of shaking so regular trays were a real problem. I found these, and they were a Godsend! One of my sisters (who used his when visiting) loved them, too. Now I have my own for freezing various things, like basil cubes for soups.
customer_reviews.author: K9Morkie

customer_reviews.title: World's greatest ice cube tray..
customer_reviews.text: They NEVER SPILL.. Yes, it's true. Ingenious design. No more headaches. It hits ALL marks. Easy to fill, smooth out the silicone to create a deal.. be free to then throw in freezer half hazardously.. then in what seems like record time to freeze (maybe 2 hours?!).. beautiful ice cubes!❄️ Easy release. No yucky smell. If you use ice often, treat yourself. Buy one.. hell, buy multiple! I've worked up to 3 with the daily smoothies..
customer_reviews.author: Bebe Blondell

customer_reviews.title: When I received this OXO Good Grips tray, I gotta say it was a good day.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted an ice cube tray I could use in a crowded freezer, something I could leave sideways or have items stacked on top. Pros: No-spill cover for allows you to place tray in freezer at any angle. Low profile, two OXO trays stacked are just a little bit higher than a standard tray. Ice stays fresh. Can stack other freezer items on top of tray without fear of getting dirt or foreign particles in ice. Cons: Ice cubes are a little smaller than traditional tray, but not that much smaller. Bottom Line: Great addition to the freezer. My ice has never been icier. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great durable tray
customer_reviews.text: I love the no drip effect of the silicone lid and for keeping the ice clean. These trays are easy to clean. A little pricy but worth the investment. I have had the “typical” ice cube trays in the teal lid and have lasted 3 years, bought on a whim as they were the only ones at a local store when I registered for my wedding. They will last a long long time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice ice tray, don't use it on carbonated drinks or soft drinks (i.e. soda).
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice ice sticks tray for bottled water (you can use it as regular ice cubes on glasses, obviously). Easy to use and somewhat easy to clean. I got this to use it on bottled water and then I wanted to give it a try on a soda... bad idea, coke was cool already but wanted to add a few ice sticks on it, once I put the first ice stick into the bottle it poured out half of it just like if it were a Mentos exploding effect.
customer_reviews.author: Emilesp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for water bottles, we use them all year round
customer_reviews.text: As a family we do not use ice often in the house, the ice machine is off. BUT for the water bottles we use ice to keep water cool through the day for the kids. These are perfect for the water bottles. They come home after school and there is still a little ice in the bottom. So they are able to drink cool refreshing water throughout the day. My wife also uses these for her water bottles she brings to work, again; cool, refreshing water throughout the day without having to smash up ice cubes. This tray is such a great discovery.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Quayle

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how easy the cubes were to remove. I literally just pushed on one end of a cube and out it came. I love how the silicone top smoothly covers the top and that you can simply turn it vertically to drain the extra water. Also with the attached lid you don't have 2 pieces to mess with. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mykey

customer_reviews.title: The ice is small enough for bottles
customer_reviews.text: I like the ice is small enough to put in water bottles and that the ice comes out easy enough. However I'm not crazy about the water overflow. It spills all over when trying to put into freezer. Otherwise I love the size and convenient of having a smaller tray in my freezer that don't take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Puffalump..

customer_reviews.title: Ice comes out so easily
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many ice trays, including other ones made by OXO. This one is WAY better. The ice comes out super easily. It just slips right out and never gets stuck in the tray. I also like the silicone topper. It makes it easy if you overfill the tray with water, you can lay the top down and push out the excess. It is also really easy to stack in the freezer and doesnt take up so much space like other ones. One thing I would love to see OXO make is a tray they fits with these. I want to be able to just dump out the ice in a really nice looking tray.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hambley

customer_reviews.title: Worked “well” but tasted gross
customer_reviews.text: Works well and seals as advertised, but the ice cubes tasted gross. I washed them thoroughly before (twice) and they were still gross. Not sure if it’s my freezer or the trays. The cubes were very easy to take out though which was initially my main concern
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should but absorbs odors.
customer_reviews.text: This is a step up in how it seals the water to keep from spilling. It does absorb the odors of onions etc. in the freezer and for that, I removed some stars
customer_reviews.author: Linlea

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget for narrow neck water bottles
customer_reviews.text: great for narrow neck water bottles. Cubes easily come out of tray and fit in the narrow neck, refill in a couple of seconds, put down the silicone top and pop in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: SP BisbeeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to have a product where the ice cubes were easier to make and easier to remove. It's a weird process to make the easy, pretty messy considering the concept and not always uniform in shape or consistency. I would not recommend this product. I'm sure there are better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: bffwct

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: But I wish they were less expensive. I like that it doesn't matter how I hold these, the water stays in the tray. I didn't realize that I hadn't shown my 15 year old daughter how they work and demonstrated for her after she filled one incorrectly. She stood there with her mouth open, in awe of the ice tray being held vertically and not leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Best ones on the market
customer_reviews.text: I love these trays as they actually work to be able to fill/overfill then place lid on and pore out excess. Work like a charm and very easy to then stack multiple trays in the freezer!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Troup-Jensen

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! No spills in freezer!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby still doesn't want me stuffing the freezer with non-food items (lol) but this one doesn't leak so I sneak it in at night and have my great cubes for my flask in the morning. The inventor was such a clever person. Make sure it's dry before storing. The silicone flap won't allow circulation. Hubby is the cook so I let him boss me around in the kitchen! He folds and irons laundry too!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Nana

customer_reviews.title: great for making baby food.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our home made baby food. It is excellent. Easy to fill and excess overflow with get pressed out by the silicone cover, making for a nice cube in the end. The silicone cover is really a showstopper--allows you to store it at different angles but we don't typically store it fully sideways. Cleans easily as the cover is removeable. the plastic is strong enough to endure twisting to allow for easy cube removal with your finger. Would highly recommend this for all parents of infants. We no have several flavors of baby food we keep in zip lock bags and defrost 1 or 2 cubes at a time for our 6 month old.
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: NO refrigerator smells, and the ice just pops right out!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tray! The ice doesn't stick in it; it's just so easy to release the ice cubes! I love the flap on top. It really does a good job of keeping any refrigerator smells out of the ice. It also does a good job of keeping the water in when I fill it from the filtered water pitcher. I just wish I could find ice storage that does as well.
customer_reviews.author: FRAN

customer_reviews.title: The flexible flap is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I didn't fully appreciate the top flap until I used it. No ballet dance to the freezer to keep from spilling, and you can stack them on their way. Also, if you leave it for a long time without emptying, the ice does not evaporate (technically, sublimate) which is a small plus. Cubes pop out instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Beatty

customer_reviews.title: better than sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these ice cube trays. They are the first I've had that are not a struggle to get the cubes out of. It's wonderful to be able to drain excess water off before moving from the sink to the freezer. I would definitely recommend these ice cube trays to others.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Aderholdt

customer_reviews.title: Even kids don't make a mess with this one
customer_reviews.text: Does anybody still use these things?! We do, and this is the BEST ice tray ever. Just a FYI: in case you have kiddos that don't pay attention to what they're doing when scrounging for a popsickle in the freezer 🙄 I've found out that this thing can be turned upside down, right after you've filled it up and placed it in the freezer 😬 NO mess. Not a drop of water spilled.
customer_reviews.author: kristi jordan

customer_reviews.title: Longer than standard trays
customer_reviews.text: This tray is longer than standard trays and I don't think it is any easier to empty. I have an old pair OXO ice cube trays with lids that do the same thing. They do stack successfully. So if that is important and you have the room in your freezer, these will work well. If you have arthritis like I do, the silicon cover (lid) is a little easier to deal with than a ridgid one. Good product, just nothing to write home about.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleStar

customer_reviews.title: Believe the bad reviews - it's terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, this is terrible. It smells. The silicone stains. Its hard to fill - drain- seal. A total waste. Reconsider!
customer_reviews.author: seven12

customer_reviews.title: Ice Smells Like Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Have to admit, the design works for us but the ice smells like plastic when it melts. It's not the water or the freezer since our other trays are fine. Did not notice with soft drinks at first, but definitely with glass of water.
customer_reviews.author: Camerata

customer_reviews.title: Best ice cube tray ever!
customer_reviews.text: Easiest, best ice cube tray I've come across. Easy to fill. The silicon flap slaps right down, you smooth it down, tilt to pour the excess water over, then it's done. When frozen, I haven't even had to twist the tray to get the ice to come out. Instead of being "cubes" they're dome shaped, so there are no edges to get caught. You can push down on one edge of an individual cube and it pops right out. Never thought I'd use the words "magic" or "amazing" to describe an ice cube tray, but there aren't any other words!
customer_reviews.author: scharfty

customer_reviews.title: I love this for ice
customer_reviews.text: I love this for ice. I have a small fridge/freezer because I live in a studio. So I don't have much freezer space to have a whole section dedicated to ice cube trays. Which means whenever I had a normal tray, most of the water would spill out before it even made it to its location. Furthermore, the ice that came out tasted distinctly of freezer. This changes things. The lid/top makes it super easy to move the tray to the freezer without spilling. And the ice tastes so much better. Definitely recommend this for your freezer.
customer_reviews.author: airazedy

customer_reviews.title: not as deep
customer_reviews.text: The other ice cube tray from OXO is nice & deep. This is made for REALLY THIN bottles + seems to hold such a small amount of liquid. Although it's easy to use, protects well, etc, You're going to need Almost 3 if these to equal same amount of ice as a normal cube tray.
customer_reviews.author: Complimentary

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT create odorless or tasteless cubes
customer_reviews.text: These trays mechanically are amazing. The silicone lid flap creates a seal that is tight so you can position the trays any way you want without water spilling out. That's a cool trick. But that doesn't make up for the fact that the cubes taste of plastic. Not sure whether its the base or the silicone causing it but it is very noticeable and has not gone away after using them for a couple of months. I can't imagine someone not noticing. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Slash

customer_reviews.title: If you could find true love in ice cube trays
customer_reviews.text: If you could find true love in ice cube trays, these would be my soul mate. They're amazing! I live in an old, "vintage" apartment that has standard appliances--which means no ice maker for me. After being super annoyed and frustrated every time I wanted to make ice, I switched to these after seeing all the stellar reviews. And they live up to expectations! My freezer is usually packed with food so the fact that the silicone lid keeps a secure lock on the water and lets me put in the ice trays at an angle is so awesome! I have more space in my freezer, I don't have to worry about water spilling out, and I get ice!
customer_reviews.author: lily90

customer_reviews.title: Favorite ice tray thus far
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can place the ice cube tray at a 45 degree angle. First, tip the tray at 45 degree angle in sink prior to this placing in freezer to drain water. This is one of the best ice trays you can get. I do wish the design was a tad bit shorter, there is extra unnecessary space. Luckily the tray can be tilted.
customer_reviews.author: natasha gardner

customer_reviews.title: Stinky trays
customer_reviews.text: Bought these trays a couple years ago and I don't use them any more because the silicon is stinky and imparts that to ice cubes. I have cleaned them thoroughly and aired them out and they still have an odor. I also have other trays with plastic covers and the ice is fine. The concept is good however.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Martinez

customer_reviews.title: The first no-drip ice cube tray to actually work
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect ice cube tray! It's rare that I really love something ordered online without seeing the actual product, but this is just the best design ever, and the quality is there too. I've tried several types/brands of no-drip ice cube trays but this is the winner!
customer_reviews.author: dee rey

customer_reviews.title: Space saver in the freezer
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice tray. I will be buying more soon.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: It's seriously leak-proof
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly skeptical, but I stack this sideways in the fridge, no problem. If you get water in the rim, it'll spill out, but just flatten the silicone and empty it in the sink and it's fine. You do have to twist the tray to loosen the cubes like any other tray, but they slide out easily. All-in-all exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Decent product but the smell from the lid is unappealing
customer_reviews.text: Great product but the lid for the ice cube tray smells of plastic. Tried using baking soda and cleaning vinegar to get rid of the smell, but it always comes back after 2-3 uses. When filling the empty ice tray, don't fill it to the top. Always try to fill it 70-75% of the way so the ice doesn't stick to the silicone lid. Sliding the ice off the ice tray is easy (if you need help sliding the ice off the tray, try applying cold water at the bottom for 15 seconds)
customer_reviews.author: LiquidFire

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: First time, I bought 1 tray to try it out for my frozen pureed food for the baby. Then i bought 2 more trays because of how easy it is to use them. I like the silicone cover, and the ease of removing the ice cubes then I just toss them in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Yi Val

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing breast milk
customer_reviews.text: I use this to freeze breast milk into clothes cubes to bag and freeze. Each cube holds a little over 1/2 oz so it is convenient to measure out flexible quantities. The cubes can be thawed in bottles later, or put into one of those mesh bag teething gizmos. They are a little awkward to clean in the dishwasher, but not prohibitively so. I plan to use them to freeze homemade baby food once my baby is older. I really like how the covers keep the cubes clean and separate from all the other things in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bahlman

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I use this to freeze left over broth or tomato paste, about 1 Tbsp per “cube”. It’s very easy to use, the green plastic covers go on and off easily, and very easy to clean. The frozen “cubes” come out easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nubs

customer_reviews.title: Truly spill free!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised! I was looking for an ice cube tray that wouldn't spill (cause you cannot always find a perfectly horizontal spare space in your freezer...), and this works perfectly. We clean it by hand wash to keep it working well for as long as possible
customer_reviews.author: I Go

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, not too great
customer_reviews.text: I can't say I love this ice tray but it gets the job done. When you first fill it up even with the rubber part covering it, there is still definitely spillage. Maybe if you under pour on the liquid you might be able to avoid spilling. The ICE is pretty easy to get out of it the tray through once frozen.
customer_reviews.author: Drakelb

customer_reviews.title: Most Innovative, tough, best darn ice cube tray I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: And believe it or not, it works as described. Seal it, pour out extra water at front corners, and stack it, lean it, stuff it into the freezer any way you want. It really seals in the water and doesn’t spill out. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: EmmagirlTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for- I needed an ice ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for- I needed an ice tray with a cover so that junk didn't fall in my ice while it was being thrown about in the cluttered freezer, and this solved that problem. I haven't been able to get the "no leak" thing to work for me yet, because at least one of the little spaces leaks after I smooth down the cover, but I'm not worried about it because that isn't what I needed it for anyway. I can periodically pop the whole thing in the dishwasher too after pulling off the silicone top, so it's convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy-Peasy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product because my fridge's ice-maker quit. So easy to empty this tray that I used it for months rather than tend to the ice-maker. Turned out all the ice-maker needed was a rest to clear excess ice but I've continued to use the tray as it's so easy! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: No Trump

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: It may seem silly to rave about an ice tray, but this one makes it easy to use even when the tray can't be stored horizontally. Also, my old style ice trays end up with the ice half evaporated before I can use it - doesn't happen with this because the ice is sealed in. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D.

customer_reviews.title: Like concept, but would be better sealed
customer_reviews.text: I like the lid on it because its flexible , but it does leak if it tilts. I have a large bottom drawer as my Freezer on my fridge and I usually have to lay these on top of frozen dinners or balance them on whatever is in there, since my Samsung Fridge doesn't make ice as quickly as my husband goes through it. Also, I use filtered water from my Culligan in the trays but sometimes the ice cubes fall apart or are fractured when I take them out of the tray. Not sure why that happens.
customer_reviews.author: mkike1

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR BABY FOOD MAKING
customer_reviews.text: I USED THESE PRIMARILY FOR FREEZING BABY FOOD PUREE. THEY WERE PERFECT FOR WHAT MY BABY WAS EATING AT THE TIME. EACH CUBE IS JUST UNDER AN OUNCE OF FOOD. THESE CUBE TRAYS WERE GREAT BECAUSE THEY DIDN'T SPILL EVEN IF SITTING SIDEWAYS IN THE FREEZER.
customer_reviews.author: MeghanS

customer_reviews.title: Best ice cube tray ever!
customer_reviews.text: We thought we'd try getting a really good ice cube tray before investing in an icecube machine, and yup, we're not gonna be getting the machine anytime soon! This is excellent. I was skeptical about whether the silicone would really seal in the water, but this really works. And the ice cubes are a breeze to get out! Also, more ice than the previous tray we had, which barely made enough for our 2 morning iced coffees. Would strongly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lea Verou

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill. Seals up nicely...doesn't spill water in freezer before freezing. Easy to get the ice cubes out. Love that they have no "freezer" taste. At first thought it was priced too high but now feel that it's well worth the price. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of it not leaking but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: SouthernMT

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this ice cube tray
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this ice cube tray. It works very well, uniform cubes, the little lip around the edge catches anything that spills over, and it's easy to remove the cubes. The only reason for a 4 star review is because although it's true it can be rotated all directions with the blue seal on it--if the seal is bumped at all or slightly pushed to create an air gap--liquid spills EVERYWHERE. This was a highly unpleasant experience cleaning up tea from the floor. So, as long as you're extremely careful with it, it should work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Item can only be used at angles up to 45degrees
customer_reviews.text: Blurb on Amazon said the ice-cube maker can be filled with water and that the top will seal so that the item can be placed in a freezer at any angle and will not spill water. This is not the case. If you can keep your ice cube maker at less than 45degrees from upright until the water has frozen, this item works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky B

customer_reviews.title: I bought a second one, but....
customer_reviews.text: It makes great ice cubes (actually half-moons) that come out of the tray easily. But that's after I drilled a hole in the bottom of the tray. The problem is that the ice cubes are made in a "plateau" surrounded by a channel and a deeper pocket at the handle end. That's a problem because when you fill the tray, water collects in the channel and pocket then freezes solid, creating a weird ice sculpture. So I drilled hole in the "pocket" near the handle to drain the water before putting the tray in the freezer, then ordered a second tray. But the designer needs a talking-to :-)
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sealable lid and makes perfect ice cubes!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and clean! Just press firmly and run your hand across to seal. Don’t overfill with water (my mistake the first time using it) because the ice cubes will push the lid up once they freeze. It seals nicely and keeps my ice clean/fresh. I bought this specifically to keep it at work and it’s fast and convenient to use. The ice cubes come out easily and all in one piece (unlike others I’ve tried).
customer_reviews.author: Monica J.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for messy work freezer
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it would leak, especially since using it in work freezer. It has never leaked. The ONLY consideration I have is that I feel I have empty it before adding new ice. So I empty it, add new water, then there's a period of time while it's freezing where I have no ice. Because once the ice forms, the lid isn't suctioned on anymore, so if there is ice in there, I can't add water without it leaking. BUT if I empty it first, everything works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Finally I can have fresh ice, even if I don't use it all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I've had an ice problem for years. Ice get's stale and evaporates if I don't use it frequently enough. I've even tried buying bags of ice, but even that gets stale and ends up all stuck together so I have to smash it on the counter to get ice cubes out. From time to time I've searched for ice cube trays and this last time I found exactly what I was looking for. These trays work great. Pour your water in, run your hand along the cover, and put it in the freezer. They keep my ice fresh, even if I don't use it all the time, and I haven't found a shrunken, evaporated cube yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Mess free ice cube making can be yours for the low price of 9.99. Sure, you can get something similar at the dollar store, but it's just that, similar. This reduces condensation in your freezer by keeping the water covered until it turns to ice and filling is a breeze. Getting the cubes out is also a painless experience (except if you push down to hard and too close to the edge and bend your fingernail upward, ouch!) and requires much less force than you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Best ice cube trays I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: So I have a tendency to overfill days so you have to kind of under fill them Because of course water expands when it freezes I still like them though probably some of the best ice cube trays I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.author: Charles golden

customer_reviews.title: Best ice cubes trays ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Best ice cube trays ever. They seal the water in so you can put them literally anywhere in your freezer, they make great sized and shaped “cubes”, they stay covered by the silicone lid in the freezer so the ice stays fresh and the cubes are easy to remove from the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Millman

customer_reviews.title: takes up more space than expected
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, and the ice cube it produces are good. However, I got these thinking the ability to place at an angle would be good for small freezers. Unfortunately those gains are undermined by the sheer size of these trays — there’s an extra lip around that makes them quite long and wide.
customer_reviews.author: mollymcp

customer_reviews.title: This thing is absolutely fantastic and totally works as described
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely fantastic and totally works as described. you really can just fill it with water and quickly slide your hand and get a 90% seal. Slide twice or slowly and you'll seal it up 100% and can store it safely without leakage. and its easy to quickly fill with that overrun channeling on the side, that just pours out once you seal up the cube section. its perfect perfect because i use water from a container to fill the tray and would otherwise spill onto a my floors, as opposed to filling it up with tap water that could just run into the sink
customer_reviews.author: A. Quach

customer_reviews.title: Adds bad taste to ice
customer_reviews.text: Just stick to the normal rubber maid ice trays. This left a wierd taste in my ice and was also pretty difficult to fill up given how shallow the cube slots were. I ended up throwing mine out because of the bad taste after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hermelyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy Ice Making
customer_reviews.text: We sometimes have a very full freezer, so trying to find places to put the ice trays was tough. These have allowed us to put them in sideways at times, and as long as you get rid of the excess liquid first, they do not spill. It is really nice to not have to worry about this every time we put them in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer and Brad

customer_reviews.title: THe easy and ice of a flat tray without the spillage
customer_reviews.text: You fill it at your sink. You put the silicone flap on top. You smooth it out. You dump the extra water. It can lie on an angle in the freezer and won't leak. Brilliant. Does NOT fit into smaller dorm-style fridge freezers. A half sized one would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Tomele

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips No-Spill Ice Cube Tray with Silicone Lid
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Ice Cube TrayChange the way you keep cool with the OXO GG No-Spill Ice Cube Tray. The innovative silicone lid of seals water into the Tray and keeps it from leaking out – at any angle! Simply fill the Tray with water, press the silicone lid over the Tray and smooth the lid while pouring out any excess water. The silicone lid forms a seal, so you don’t have to worry about tipping or tilting the Tray when you carry it from sink to freezer. Now you can store the Ice Cube Tray in any position, even on an angle between the ice cream and the frozen veggies in a crowded freezer! The lid allows for stacking multiple ice cube trays or other items on top and prevents freezer odor from permeating your cubes.

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Silicone lid seals water into Tray before freezing
Sealed lid allows for stacking and angled storage in freezer
Comfortable handle for a firm grip while filling or carrying
Innovative rounded ice cube shape releases cubes easily
Keeps ice cubes from absorbing freezer odors
Silicone lid is removable for easy cleaning; Top-rack dishwasher safe

The OXO Better Guarantee: If you experience an issue with your OXO product, get in touch with us for a repair or replacement. We’re grateful for the opportunity to learn from your experience, and we’ll make it better.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,376 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
